comments: Since A(n,3) = A(n+1,4), A(n,3) gives essentially the same sequence.The next term is in the range 2816-3276.Let T_n be the set of SDS-maps of sequential dynamical systems defined over the complete graph K_n in which all vertices have the same vertex function (defined using a set of two possible vertex states). Then a(n) is the maximum number of period-2 orbits that a function in T_n can have. - _Colin Defant_, Sep 15 2015a(n) is identical to the independence number of the n-halved cube graph up to at least n = 12. It seems reasonable to conjecture the two are identical for all n. - _Eric W. Weisstein_, Dec 31 2015
references: J. H. Conway and N. J. A. Sloane, "Sphere Packings, Lattices and Groups", Springer-Verlag, p. 248.
